author: Patrick Deaville
title: Leesville High School graduation rescheduled
text:
LEESVILLE, La. (KPLC) - Due to the possibility of inclement weather, the Leesville High School graduation has been rescheduled, according to the Vernon Parish School Board.
The ceremony will now be held in the football stadium at 7 p.m. on on Friday, May 10.
According to the school’s website, all seniors are asked to call the school at 337-239-3464 to acknowledge that they know that the date has changed.
Copyright 2024 KPLC. All rights reserved.

author: VNExplorer
title: Trafficante di Viagra illegale, arrestati prete cattolico e il suo fidanzato
text:
Trafficante di Viagra, arrestati prete cattolico e il suo fidanzato
Un prete spagnolo è stato arrestato con l’accusa di aver venduto illegalmente il Viagra da casa sua. Il religioso è stato fermato nella città di Don Benito, nella provincia occidentale di Badajoz, vicino al confine della Spagna con il Portogallo. La polizia ha arrestato il sospettato nella canonica dove viveva con un uomo descritto come suo partner, anch’egli arrestato dopo che la polizia aveva effettuato una perquisizione della proprietà.
LEGGI ANCHE
Martedì i due sono andati in tribunale e sono stati interrogati da un magistrato inquirente per più di quattro ore. Il sacerdote, chiamato localmente Alfonso Raul Masa Soto, è stato rilasciato su cauzione e gli è stato ordinato di presentarsi al tribunale locale ogni quindici giorni. Nel frattempo, il suo partner non identificato è stato incarcerato in attesa di un’indagine penale in corso. Gli arresti sono avvenuti lunedì dopo un’indagine durata settimane della Guardia Civil.
Sequestrati al prete Viagra e potenti afrodisiaci Si dice che il Viagra sia stato trovato all’interno della canonica insieme ad altri farmaci descritti come “potenti afrodisiaci”. La diocesi di Plasencia, alla quale appartiene don Benito, ha espresso il proprio rammarico per la detenzione del sacerdote a causa del “dolore e sofferenza” che comporta. Si legge in un comunicato: “Siamo in attesa di ulteriori chiarimenti mentre l’indagine continua. Seguiamo il suo sviluppo con cautela e rispetto per le persone coinvolte e siamo pronti a collaborare in tutto ciò che sarà necessario”.
Un portavoce del governo centrale della regione ha confermato che hanno avuto luogo due arresti ma non ha fornito ulteriori dettagli. Il sacerdote è stato descritto localmente come un uomo “molto popolare”. Il suo avvocato Jesus Carretero ha insistito sul fatto che non c’erano prove incriminanti contro di lui. Ha aggiunto: “Ciò che viene detto sul mio cliente è totalmente falso. Tutto si risolverà man mano che le indagini continueranno”.
LEGGI LE ALTRE NOTIZIE DI MONDO

author: Uniindia News Service
title: TN: PM Modi concludes 45-hour long meditation at Vivekananda Rock Memorial
text: States » SouthPosted at: Jun 1 2024 6:54PM TN: PM Modi concludes 45-hour long meditation at Vivekananda Rock MemorialKanyakumari (Tamil Nadu), Jun 1 (UNI) Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday concluded his 45-hour long meditation session at the iconic Vivekananda Rock Memorial off Kanyakumari coast, ahead of the 18th Lok Sabha election results.Modi, who embarked on a three-day spiritual tour to Tamil Nadu, after concluding his election campaign in Punjab’s Hoshiarpur for the seventh and final phase of the Parliamentary election, commenced his meditation at the Vivekananda Rock Memorial on Thursday evening.After ending the meditation, he took a group photo with the staff of Vivekananda Kendra at the memorial.Modi then visited the 41-metre tall statue of Tamil saint-poet Thiruvalluvar located on a huge rock near the Vivekananda Rock Memorial and paid floral tributes.Later, the Prime Minister left for Thiruvananthapuram.Earlier, he offered special prayers at the historic Sri Bhagavathi Amman Temple, one of the “108 Shakthi Peedams” at Kanyakumari on May 30 evening and sailed to the Vivekananda Rock Memorial at mid-sea where he commenced the meditation session at the Dhyana Mandapam amid a blanket security cover.The PM, clad in Saffron shirt, shawl and dhoti performed “Surya Arghya,” a religious practice in Hinduism offering water to Lord Surya (Sun) and prayed to the Sun god with folded hands on the second day of the meditation session.The BJP on its “X: handle, (formerly Twitter) released a video and different photos of Modi performing Surya Arghya and then meditating at the memorial holding the prayer beads.It was believed that Swami Vivekananda meditated for three days and nights on the rock until he attained “Enlightenment.”The opposition parties, including the Congress, DMK, Trinamool Congress, CPI, CPI(M) and AAP strongly objected to the meditation session of the Prime Minister terming it as a poll ploy and violate the Model Code of Conduct.Modi, who completed a second term and vying for a third consecutive term, held around 206 election campaign events, including rallies and roadshows in 75 days across the country.It may be recalled that the PM had visited Shivaji’s Pratapgarh in 2014 and meditated in a holy cave near the Kedarnath shrine in Uttarakhand in May 2019 after the polling concluded for the 16th and 17th Lok Sabha elections, respectively.UNI GSM CS1855Tags: #TN: PM Modi concludes 45-hour long meditation at Vivekananda Rock Memorial

author: 蘇憶歡
title: 台北人十大死因出爐　癌症連52年奪冠「1年奪5千條命」│TVBS新聞網
text:
台北市衛生局今（3）日公布113年台北市十大死因，其中排名第一的依舊是惡性腫瘤（癌症），共造成5379人死亡，其次則是心臟疾病和肺炎。而在癌症中，第一名癌王和全國十大死因排名相同為「氣管、支氣管和肺癌」，不可輕忽。而113年度台北市死亡人數達1萬9734人，相較前一年減少約4%。
113年台北市十大死因依序為，（1）惡性腫瘤（癌症）、（2）心臟疾病、（3）肺炎、（4）腦血管疾病、（5）慢性下呼吸道疾病、（6）高血壓性疾病、（7）糖尿病、（8）腎炎、腎病症候群及腎病變、（9）事故傷害、（10）血管性及未明示之失智症。
更多新聞： 中暑兇手不是熱？醫示警：只喝水不夠「缺這物」恐昏迷致命
和112年相比，癌症、心臟疾病、肺炎、腦血管疾病，仍續居前4位死因，而心臟疾病（高血壓性疾病除外）的死亡率則明顯下降，肺炎死亡則是大幅上升。
更多新聞： 紙本帳單要收費！遠傳公告：75歲以下用戶「明年起每期都要付」
而在癌症部分，113年死亡人數達5379人，占總死亡人數27.3%，比前一年增加1%。在癌症死因排名部分，依序為（1）氣管、支氣管和肺癌、（2）女性乳癌、（3）結腸、直腸和肛門癌、（4）肝和肝內膽管癌、（5）前列腺（攝護腺）癌、（6）胰臟癌、（7）胃癌、（8）口腔癌、（9）卵巢癌、（10）非何杰金氏淋巴瘤。與112年相比，女性乳癌及卵巢癌的死亡率和順位，皆上升。
更多新聞： iPhone17超大外觀改變！傳「蘋果Logo將更換位置」
統計顯示，113年台北市死亡人數共1萬9734人，比112年減少821人、約4%，而這主要原因就是和COVID-19死亡人數減少相關。另外，在死亡率部分，每十萬人約788.9人，下降4.2%，排除人口老化因素的話，標準死亡率下降6.5%。

author: National Weather Service
title: Excessive Heat Warning issued August 1 at 1:42PM MST until August 5 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix AZ
text:
Excessive Heat Warning issued August 1 at 1:42PM MST until August 5 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix AZ
* WHAT…Dangerously hot conditions. Afternoon temperatures 109 to
116 expected. Major to Extreme Heat Risk. Overexposure can cause
heat cramps and heat exhaustion to develop and, without
intervention, can lead to heat stroke.
* WHERE…Portions of southwest Arizona and southeast and southern
California.
* WHEN…From 10 AM MST /10 AM PDT/ Saturday to 11 PM MST /11 PM
PDT/ Monday.
* IMPACTS…Heat related illnesses increase significantly during
extreme heat events.
An Excessive Heat Warning means that a period of very hot
temperatures, even by local standards, will occur. Actions should be
taken to lessen the impact of the extreme heat.
Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When
possible, reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or
evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat
stroke. Wear lightweight and loose-fitting clothing when possible
and drink plenty of water.
To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and
Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in
shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat
should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an
emergency! Call 9 1 1.
Public cooling shelters are available in some areas. Consult county
officials for more details.

organizations.name: nws phoenix az excessive heat warning

author: Devdiscourse News Desk
title: Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas Calls on U.N. to Stop Gaza War | Law-Order
text: Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas Calls on U.N. to Stop Gaza War Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas urged the U.N. General Assembly to stop the Gaza war between Israel and Hamas militants, highlighting Gaza's devastation. Abbas called for a permanent ceasefire, humanitarian aid delivery, and a full Israeli military withdrawal. He also advocated for Palestinian Authority control over all territories and post-war elections. Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas addressed the U.N. General Assembly, urging immediate action to halt the ongoing war in Gaza between Israel and Hamas militants. Abbas highlighted the devastation in Gaza, stating it was no longer livable, and implored the international community to intervene. The conflict, which began on Oct. 7, 2023, has resulted in severe casualties on both sides. Hamas militants initiated the hostilities by attacking Israeli communities, leading to retaliatory actions from Israel that have severely impacted Gaza's population. Abbas called for a comprehensive ceasefire, the end of Israeli settler attacks in the West Bank and East Jerusalem, unimpeded humanitarian aid to Gaza, and the complete withdrawal of Israeli forces. He also emphasized the need for the Palestinian Authority to have full control over Palestinian territories and announced plans for elections after the war. (With inputs from agencies.) author: Nasiru Eneji Abdulrasheed
title: TotalEnergies and NNPC Achieve Zero Routine Gas Flare in Nigeria: A Leap Towards Sustainability
text:
In a significant stride towards environmental stewardship and economic sustainability, TotalEnergies, in partnership with the Nigerian National Petroleum Company Limited (NNPC), has announced the achievement of zero routine gas flare across all its operational assets in Nigeria. This landmark achievement not only aligns with Nigeria's ambitious goal to eliminate gas flaring by 2030 but also marks a pivotal shift in the nation's journey towards a low carbon economy. At the heart of this transformation is a commitment to bolster local content and sustainability within the Nigerian oil and gas sector, a move that underscores the sector's potential in driving socio-economic growth while adhering to environmental conservation norms.
Innovating for a Sustainable Future
The recent commencement of production at TotalEnergies' Akpo West field exemplifies the company's dedication to innovation and sustainability. This development is particularly noteworthy against the backdrop of challenges faced by the Nigerian natural gas sector, including underinvestment due to outstanding debts and the critical need for financial injections to support the Nigeria-Morocco gas pipeline project. Amid these complexities, TotalEnergies' pledge to eradicate routine gas flaring by 2030 and its investments in renewable energy sources signal a transformative shift towards less carbon-intensive energy production modalities. These initiatives not only reflect TotalEnergies' environmental consciousness but also its role as a catalyst for change in the broader energy landscape.
Strengthening Local Ties and Economic Growth
The emphasis on local content and community engagement stands as a cornerstone of TotalEnergies' operational philosophy in Nigeria. Cyprian Ojum, Deputy General Manager of Nigerian Content at TotalEnergies Upstream Companies in Nigeria, highlighted the company's commitment to the Nigerian Oil and Gas Industry Development Act of 2010. By prioritizing local content, TotalEnergies is fostering an ecosystem that promotes sustained industry growth and socio-economic development. Similarly, PETAN Chairman Nicolas Odinuwe's call for the judicious use of local content development funds underscores the critical role of government and institutional support in harnessing the full potential of local initiatives. Furthermore, the Minister of State for Petroleum Resources (Oil), Heineken Lokpobiri, underscored the strategic importance of gas as a catalyst for achieving national development goals, advocating for enhanced cooperation to amplify the impact of ongoing government efforts.
Addressing Challenges Head-on
While the achievements of TotalEnergies and NNPC in Nigeria are laudable, the sector is not without its challenges. The Nigerian government's endeavors to propel the Nigeria-Morocco gas pipeline project forward, coupled with NNPC's dialogue with a South Korean consortium for potential partnerships, reflect the proactive steps being taken to surmount financial and operational hurdles. However, concerns raised by Transparency International regarding corruption in Nigeria's crude oil sector serve as a reminder of the systemic issues that can undermine progress. Addressing these challenges requires a concerted effort from all stakeholders to ensure transparency, accountability, and ethical governance in the pursuit of sustainable energy solutions.
In conclusion, the collaborative efforts of TotalEnergies and NNPC in achieving zero routine gas flare and emphasizing local content and sustainability herald a new era for the Nigerian oil and gas sector. This not only aligns with global environmental goals but also amplifies the sector's role in driving socio-economic development. As Nigeria strides towards a low carbon economy, the commitment to innovation, community engagement, and sustainable practices will be pivotal in shaping a resilient and prosperous future for the nation's energy sector.

author: ANI
title: India News | Two Rajasthan School Teachers Suspended over 'love Jihad', Conversion Allegations; Minister Orders Probe | LatestLY
text: Kota (Rajasthan) [India], February 24 (ANI): The Rajasthan government has suspended two teachers from a government school in Kota district for their alleged involvement in religious conversion and ties to banned terror outfits. Another teacher is also facing an investigation in this regard, Rajasthan Education Minister Madan Dilawar said. Also Read | Afghan National Arrested From Mumbai's Wadala for Illegal Stay in India: Live Breaking News Headlines & Updates, February 24, 2024. The suspension orders of the teachers identified as Mirza Mujahid and Firoz Khan, posted at a school in Kota's Sangod block, were issued on Thursday night following directions from the education minister. The action came after Sarva Hindu Samaj, Sangod, sent a memorandum to the Education Minister, alleging that activities of religious conversion and love jihad have been going on in the school since 2019. Also Read | Assam Cabinet Repeals Muslim Marriages and Divorces Registration Act, CM Himanta Biswa Sarma Says 'Significant Step Towards Prohibiting Child Marriages'. The memorandum also alleged that three teachers have connections with banned outfits and that they had links to Pakistani groups. The memorandum also stated that an FIR had previously been registered in this regard at Sangod police station, but no action was taken. The memorandum also claimed that one Hindu girl who was named as Muslim in the school record was abducted by Muslim youths and was yet to be traced. Dilawar, in a video statement issued on Friday, said that strict action has been initiated against three teachers in a government senior secondary school at Khajuri Odpur village in Sangod. "In the Khajoori village of Sangod panchayat samiti in Kota district, the religion of a girl in senior secondary school was mentioned as 'Islam' in the transfer certificate of a girl despite her being a Hindu. A conspiracy of religious conversion and 'love jihad' is happening there, Hindu girls are being forced to offer namaz - this has come to our notice," he said. He further said that if the teachers are found to be involved in these acts, the three of them will be terminated from the job. "As soon as this was brought to my notice, I decided to take strict action against three teachers. In this context, I suspended two teachers - Firoz Khan and Mirza Mujahideen. Further action is being taken against one Shabana. All three of them have been sent to Bikaner. I will take strict action against them after a detailed investigation. If needed, I will expel them," the state minister added. (ANI) (This is an unedited and auto-generated story from Syndicated News feed, LatestLY Staff may not have modified or edited the content body)
